signFile
The function is used to sign a document with an electronic signature (CryptoPro) on the server.
The function generates a signature file and saves it in the file properties.
Working with the
signFile
function assumes the presence of:
CryptoPro JCP software on the application server;
the private key container that is planned to be used for signing files.
Syntax
signFile
(fsFile, alias, password)
Setting
Purpose
fsFile
Instance of
of the "File" type
[FS_FILE] (or its ID) that needs to be signed.
alias
Alias of the private key container.
It is recommended to specify the parameter value using the
secretVariable
function.
password
Password to the private key container.
It is recommended to specify the parameter value using the
secretVariable
function.
Note
The function is added manually.
Example
In order to sign the "Loan agreement #854711" document with the e-signature, write down the following algorithm:
The alias of the private key container is set as a string, and the password to the container is set using the
secretVariable
function.
